skill.name: plan-approval
skill.description: Plan-approval workflow patterns for user control over AI actions in Claude Code Waypoint Plugin. Use when planning complex changes, need user approval before execution, want to prevent mistakes, or need to document proposed changes. Covers plan creation, approval checkpoints, plan deviation tracking, revision management, and learning from approved/rejected plans.
skill.summary: Plan-approval workflow patterns for user control over AI actions in Claude Code Waypoint Plugin. Use...
skill.author: DojoCodingLabs

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access detected. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Enable user control over AI actions with plan approvals
content.value_statement: AI sometimes makes changes without user input. This skill adds approval checkpoints before complex or risky work. Users review and approve plans before execution. The result is safer, more controlled AI collaboration.
actual_capabilities: Generate detailed plans for complex changes
Require explicit user approval before execution
Document plan deviations and request re-approval
Store approved and rejected plans for learning
Provide templates for different plan types
limitations: Does not integrate with external project management tools
Requires user to actively review and approve
Does not track time or resource usage

use_cases.title: Review architectural changes
use_cases.description: Get approval before refactoring core components or changing system architecture

use_cases.title: Approve feature rollouts
use_cases.description: Review and approve feature implementation plans before development begins

use_cases.title: Control risky modifications
use_cases.description: Require approval for production deployments, schema changes, and breaking updates

prompt_templates.title: Simple plan request
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan adding Stripe payments to the application

prompt_templates.title: Feature with context
prompt_templates.scenario: Add context to your plan request
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan adding user authentication. Include OAuth with Google and email options. Store users in Supabase.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring request
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan refactoring the state management from Redux to React Context. Include migration strategy.

prompt_templates.title: Infrastructure change
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan migrating from Express to FastAPI. Include database migration, API compatibility, and testing approach.

output: Here is the plan for adding user authentication:
Add email and OAuth authentication with Supabase Auth.
- Files to create: lib/auth.ts, app/login/page.tsx, app/auth/callback/route.ts
- Supabase Auth handles security, token refresh, and OAuth providers
- Server components for secure session handling
- Session handling complexity: Mitigate with SSR helpers
- OAuth provider downtime: Fallback to email
Reply 'approve' to proceed, 'modify: changes' to adjust, or 'reject' to cancel.

best_practices: Always require approval for database changes, deployments, and breaking changes
Provide detailed plans with risks, alternatives, and rollback strategies
Wait for explicit approval keywords like 'approve' or 'proceed'
Learn from rejected plans and adjust future approaches
anti_patterns: Skipping approval for complex changes that affect many files
Assuming silence or vague responses mean approval
Deviating from the approved plan without asking first
Creating vague plans without specific file lists or risks

faq.question: What tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It is part of the Claude Code Waypoint Plugin.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill only generates plans and manages approvals. Execution requires explicit user approval.

faq.question: Can I use this with other Claude Code skills?
faq.answer: Yes. It integrates with memory-management for storing preferences and context-persistence for tracking progress.

faq.question: Where are plans stored?
faq.answer: Plans are stored in .claude/memory/plans/ directory as JSON files. All data stays local.

faq.question: What types of changes require approval?
faq.answer: Database changes, breaking API changes, architecture refactors, production deployments, and any change affecting more than 5 files.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Claude prompting?
faq.answer: Regular prompting executes immediately. This skill adds a checkpoint layer requiring explicit user sign-off before work begins.
